circumstances: On approach to Jackson-McKellar Sipes Airport, the pilot encountered foggy conditions. The pilot decided to reduce his altitude and passed below the minimum descent altitude when the airplane struck trees and crashed three miles short of runway. The aircraft was destroyed and both occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
The pilot failed to follow the approved procedures. The following factors were reported: 
- Improper IFR operation,
- Overcast at 400 feet and fog, 
- Descended below MDA of 760 feet approximately 3 miles before runway threshold.
